text.__SUMMARY__: Acacia scleroclada is a shrub of the genus Acacia and the subgenus Phyllodineae. It is native to an area in the Mid West and Wheatbelt regions of Western Australia.The spreading pungent shrub typically grows to a height of 0.5 to 1.2 metres (2 to 4 ft). It blooms from June to September and produces yellow flowers.
